question_sentence: The prime minister of which country has denied reports he plans to resign after losing his parliamentary majority?
evidence: Shigeru Ishiba denied reports in the Japanese media that he was going to announce his resignation, saying such claims were "completely unfounded". Last Sunday, the coalition led by his Liberal Democratic Party – which has been in power with minor interruptions since 1955 – lost control of the upper house, having already lost the lower house in October.

question_sentence: Which NFL team did Donald Trump threaten to block from building a new stadium unless it changed its name?
evidence: Donald Trump has threatened to block a new stadium deal unless the Washington Commanders change their name back to the "Redskins", a name they dropped in 2020 after Native American groups said it perpetuated racist stereotypes. He also urged the Cleveland Guardians to return to the name "Indians". Neither team has indicated that they plan to follow Trump's orders.

question_sentence: Who scored a last-minute equaliser to kick-start England women's Euro semi-final comeback against Italy?
evidence: Arsenal forward Agyemang, whose Ghanaian surname means "Saviour of Nations", came on in the 86th minute against Italy to score a stoppage-time equaliser, before fellow late substitute Chloe Kelly scored the winner in extra-time. England's women now face Spain in Sunday night's final.

question_sentence: What typhoon struck both the Philippines and Vietnam?
evidence: Typhoon Wipha made landfall in northern Vietnam on Tuesday, bringing 60mph winds and heavy rain. In the Philippines, Wipha intensified seasonal monsoon rains, triggering widespread flooding and forcing 80,000 people into emergency shelters. The typhoon has also threatened parts of Taiwan and southern China.

question_sentence: Walking how many steps per day reduces the risk of a host of serious diseases, according to new research?
evidence: Although 10,000 is commonly cited as the "magic number", only 7,000 could be sufficient to feel the health benefits of walking. A large meta-analysis published in The Lancet Public Health found that those who walked 7,000 steps per day had a significantly lower risk of developing a range of serious conditions, including dementia, depression and type 2 diabetes, compared to those who walked 2,000 steps per day.

question_sentence: A married tech CEO has resigned after being caught on a kiss cam canoodling with another woman at which concert?
evidence: CEO Andy Byron resigned after he and the company's chief people officer, Kristin Cabot, went viral for their kiss-cam moment at a Coldplay concert in Foxborough, Massachusetts. The couple were allegedly having an affair and were caught on the big screen cosying up together.

question_sentence: Venus Williams became the oldest woman tennis player to win a WTA singles match since 2004. How old is she?
evidence: Venus Williams beat 23-year-old fellow American Peyton Stearns 6-3, 6-4 in the first round of the Washington Open. The victory makes her the second oldest woman to win a singles match at the top level of professional tennis. Martina Navratilova still holds the record, winning at Wimbledon in 2004 at the age of 47.

question_sentence: A French court sentenced three people to jail over exploitation of workers in which industry?
evidence: A director of a recruitment company and two associates were sentenced by a French court on Monday after being convicted of trafficking undocumented migrants to work in vineyards. The migrant labourers, who worked 13-hour days and were housed in "appalling" conditions, picked grapes that were then sold on to as many as 14 champagne houses.

question_sentence: Which of these is not among the 72 new hobby badges now available to Girl Guides in the UK?
evidence: Girlguiding UK says the new badges reflect the diverse interests of modern girls. The youngest Rainbows guides can gain a badge for "rescuing bees" while older Rangers are able to express their passion for "fandoms". The new badges also include more traditional pursuits like gardening, crafting and music, while the "hostess" badge – introduced in the 1960s and retired in 2018 – has been revived as the "celebrations" badge.

question_sentence: A new poll shows that Donald Trump's support among what demographic has gone down by eight points?
evidence: A CBS/YouGov survey of 2,343 Americans found 47% of male respondents approve of the president's performance – down from the 54% who backed him before the 2024 election. Inflation worries appear to be fuelling the fall-off, with 65% of men polled saying Trump has not done enough to lower prices.

question_sentence: Which city may soon become the first modern capital in the world to run completely out of water?
evidence: Population growth, the climate crisis and relentless over-extraction have depleted groundwater levels, experts say, and nearly half of Kabul’s boreholes have already gone dry.

question_sentence: Why is President Trump threatening to restrict a stadium deal for the NFL’s Washington Commanders in DC?
choices: He said he can make a better deal in Maryland
He doesn’t like the football team’s name
He wants to personally choose the team’s quarterback
evidence: Despite decades of criticism from Native American groups, Trump wants the Washington Commanders to change their name back to the “Redskins.”

question_sentence: How much money did the federal government spend to deploy 700 Marines and 4,000 California National Guard members to Los Angeles in response to anti-ICE protests?
evidence: A senior Pentagon official said that the mobilization of the Marines and the National Guard was estimated to cost $134 million.

question_sentence: House Republicans want to rename the Kennedy Center’s opera house after which public figure?
evidence: GOP lawmakers included language that would designate the opera house as the “First Lady Melania Trump Opera House” in an amendment to a spending bill for the Interior Department.

question_sentence: Why did Ford recall nearly 700,000 SUVs this week?
choices: Fuel injector may cause a fire
evidence: Owners of Bronco Sport and Escape vehicles should bring in their vehicles because a fuel injector may crack and leak, potentially causing a fire.

question_sentence: Which world leader is suing right-wing podcaster Candace Owens for defamation?
evidence: In March, the right-wing podcaster revived a conspiracy theory about France’s first lady, Brigitte Macron.

question_sentence: Researchers have finally decoded an error in the 12th-century epic, “The Song of Wade.” Apparently, the hero doesn’t battle elves. What does he fight?
evidence: Researchers say a scribe’s transcription error changed a “w” to a “y” and so “elves” is actually “wolves,” and the term was allegorical, referring to dangerous men.

question_sentence: Which two actors are reuniting for a new body-switching movie?
choices: Jamie Lee Curtis and Lindsay Lohan
evidence: “Freakier Friday,” starring Jamie Lee Curtis and Lindsay Lohan, hits theaters on August 8.

question_sentence: Which famous film prop just sold at auction for $14.75 million?
choices: The ruby slippers from “The Wizard of Oz”
The DeLorean from “Back to the Future”
evidence: It was “Rosebud,” the famed wooden sled at the heart of Orson Welles’ classic 1941 movie.

question_sentence: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani is co-writing a new children’s book. What’s it about?
evidence: The book, “Decoy Saves Opening Day,” will go on sale on February 3, 2026.
